perturbation.original_text: This agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of the 15th day of December, 1997 ("Effective Date"), by and between Excite, Inc., a California corporation, located at 555 Broadway, Redwood City, California 94063 ("Excite"), and NetGrocer, Inc. a Delaware corporation, located at 333 Seventh avenue, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10001 ("NetGrocer").
perturbation.changed_text: This contract ("Agreement") is entered into as of the 15th day of December, 1997 ("Effective Date"), by and between Excite, Inc., a California corporation, located at 555 Broadway, Redwood City, California 94063 ("Excite"), and NetGrocer, Inc. a Delaware corporation, located at 333 Seventh avenue, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10001 ("Retailer").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Agreement' is referred to as 'contract' in the changed text. Furthermore, 'NetGrocer' is changed to 'Retailer'. This introduces ambiguity because it is unclear whether 'Retailer' and 'NetGrocer' refer to the same entity throughout the document.

perturbation.original_text: For the term of the Agreement, Excite will display NetGrocer's advertising banners in general rotation on the Excite Site, on the MailExcite free email service and on Excite's Internet chat service.
perturbation.changed_text: For the term of the contract, Excite will display Retailer's advertising banners in general rotation on the Excite Site, on the MailExcite free email service and on Excite's Internet chat service.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 1(d), the term 'Agreement' has been switched with the word 'contract' and NetGrocer is changed to Retailer. This contradicts the original definition in the preamble and introduces uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: NetGrocer retains all right, title and interest to information regarding customers who access the NetGrocer Site pursuant to the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Retailer retains all right, title and interest to information regarding consumers who access the Retailer Site pursuant to this contract.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 4, 'NetGrocer' changed to 'Retailer', 'customers' changed to 'consumers', 'NetGrocer Site' changed to 'Retailer Site' and 'Agreement' changed to 'contract'. If Retailer and NetGrocer are not the same, and customers/consumers access the different sites, there will be uncertainty as to who owns the data.
